alert.note: Alert for Marfa Plateau; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jeff Davis and southwestern Culberson Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Van Horn, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Van Horn, Plateau, Culberson County Airport and Lobo. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Marfa Plateau; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
